intro: Mesembryanthemum piquetbergense, commonly known as the Piquetberg sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the cooler months, typically in spring. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
